answerText: diffusion[10] Molecular diffusion is driven by differences in this quantity. This value is conjugate to the particle number and its value in a solution is equal to its standard value plus R times the natural log of the activity.

question: Question: One law governing this phenomenon states that J is equal to the negative D times the gradient of phi. For 10 points each: [10] Name this physical process where particles move from an area of high concentration to an area of lower concentration. Fick's two laws are useful in describing it.
